API_Description: Inserts pages from another PDF document into the current document.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'insertPages' suggests functionality related to adding pages into a document, likely from another source document.
Returns: A boolean indicating success or failure of the page insertion.
Returns_Reason: Typically, methods that perform an action like inserting pages return a boolean to indicate whether the operation was successful.

nPage.description: The 0-based index in the current document where the new pages should be inserted.
nPage.description_reason: Inserting pages requires specifying a position in the current document where the pages will be added.
nPage.type_reason: Page indices are usually represented as numbers.

cPath.description: The file path of the PDF document from which pages will be inserted.
cPath.description_reason: To insert pages from another document, the method needs to know the location of that document.
cPath.type_reason: File paths are typically represented as strings.

nStart.description: The 0-based index of the first page to insert from the source document.
nStart.description_reason: Specifying the starting page in the source document is necessary to determine which pages to insert.
nStart.type_reason: Page indices are usually represented as numbers.

nEnd.description: The 0-based index of the last page to insert from the source document.
nEnd.description_reason: Specifying the ending page in the source document is necessary to determine the range of pages to insert.
nEnd.type_reason: Page indices are usually represented as numbers.
